Header: Kashmir firing Rivals trade blame as 24 are killed
Content: India and Pakistan have traded accusations over cross-border firing in the disputed region of Kashmir that has killed at least 24 people since Friday. Eight civilians, including two children, were killed after Pakistani artillery hit two areas yesterday. Pakistan said Indian gunfire killed six civilians on its sideÂ on Monday. Tensions have flared over the long-running dispute since an Indian army base was attacked in September.
